rules: Rule1: If the job develops a new drug, then provided that it is not the case that the drug did not pass the safety test or the drug did not pass the efficacy test, the drug is ready for production.

Rule2: Whenever the job improves an existing drug, then under the condition that it is not the case that the drug did not pass the safety test or the drug did not pass the efficacy test, the drug is ready for production.
Rule3: If the job involves work on research, then either the job develops a new drug or the job improves an existing drug.
Rule4: The job involves work on research or the job involves work on development.
Rule5: Provided that the job involves work on development, then either the job develops a new drug or the job improves an existing drug.
Rule6: Under the condition that the financial product offers insurance, it covers medication.
Rule7: If the financial product offers insurance, then it does not cover medication.
Rule8: Either the financial product offers insurance, or the job does not use the facility.
Rule9: If the drug is approved by the FDA, then the drug can be sold.
Rule10: Either the drug has a patent, or if the drug requires testing, the job does not use the facility.
Rule11: Provided that the drug needs reformulation, it does not have a patent.
Rule12: Either a study has been published for the drug, or the drug needs reformulation.
Rule13: The drug passed the efficacy test or a study has not been published for the drug.
Rule14: If it is not the case that when the drug requires testing the job does not use the facility, then the drug is approved by the FDA.
Rule15: Provided that it is not the case that the drug did not pass the safety test or the drug did not pass the efficacy test, the drug is not ready for production.
Rule16: If the job does not have funding, then the job uses the facility.
facts: Fact2: The drug cannot be sold.
Fact3: The drug did not pass the safety test.
